results.title: Friendship beats the storm
results.creator_credit: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best friends Kiera Chapman and Eliza Goldsmith have been through quite a lot together. When Chapman’s family took shelter during the torando that hit Lennox Head in 2010, Goldsmith cut her feet running over to see if Chapman was ok. As they weathered the storm together, they share the experience with their family, community and with each other.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eliza Goldsmith, Kiera Chapman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For the love of...Lolo
results.creator_credit: Ayen Guinto, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.

results.title: Storm at sea, tornado on land
results.creator_credit: Kelly Lennon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
As Kelly Lennon ate breakfast, she knew it was going to be a miserable day. What followed was so terrifying that it was only when her mother returned that she felt safe.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: A True friend
results.creator_credit: Laura O'Donnell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: If Laura O’Donnell could give out an award for Best Friend, her neighbour Bree would get it. The share a close bond, despite differences and going to seperate schools. O’Donnell celebrates their friendship.

results.title: The Big roar
results.creator_credit: Daniel Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Daniel Young didn’t feel safe the night before the tornado roared through his house. After it had passed, Young’s family were safe but it had left a great wave of destruction in its path.

On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.

results.title: Bittersweet
results.creator_credit: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: What else matters?
results.creator_credit: Maree Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Maree Somerville acknowledges that, despite the devastation, the day could’ve had a different ending - one more tragic. For Somerville, it has been an opportunity to recognise what really matters in life.
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maree Somerville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Bird fancier = L'Homme aux oiseaux
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Bernard Devlin, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Staged in old Quebec City, this film is about a rebel against the time-clock, whose hobby was snaring birds but whose dream was to escape the bonds of domesticity. A kindly satire of the dreamer in every man, the film is also a memorable portrait of Quebec, the “Grande Dame” of Canadian cities. With English subtitles. Cast includes Maurice Beaupre, Rene Constantineau, Camille Fournier, Roger Lebel, Annette Leclerc. Written by Roger Lemelin. Photography by Grant McLean. Edited by Douglas Tunstell. Music by Maurice Blackburn. Sound by Joseph Champagne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Palardy, Bernard Devlin, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada

A kindly satire of the dreamer in every man, the film is also a memorable portrait of Quebec, the “Grande Dame” of Canadian cities. With English subtitles. Music by Maurice Blackburn. Sound by Joseph Champagne.

results.title: The Birth of a nation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith, Harry E Aitken, D W Griffith Productions and Epoch Producing Corporation
results.brief_description: This 1915 epic American Civil War drama, using the interwoven stories of two families - one Southern and one Northern - is one of the most influential films in the history of cinema and, because of its racism, one of the most controversial. Based on the Rev. Thomas Dixon’s deliriously racist “The Clansman”, a melodramatic novel about the American Civil War and it’s aftermath, Griffith’s film is remarkable, for it’s technical innovations and for the truly epic feel created by the carefully orchestrated, swirling masses of figures in the battle scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D.W. Griffith, Harry E Aitken, D W Griffith Productions and Epoch Producing Corporation

Thomas Dixon’s deliriously racist “The Clansman”, a melodramatic novel about the American Civil War and it’s aftermath, Griffith’s film is remarkable, for it’s technical innovations and for the truly epic feel created by the carefully orchestrated, swirling masses of figures in the battle scenes.
